description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft Common Log File System elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-20653):

1. Identify and download the relevant update package for your system from the Microsoft Update Catalog using the following links:
   - [KB5034134](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034134)
   - [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
   - [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121)

2. Apply the updates to the affected Windows versions, including:
   - Windows 10 versions 21H2, 22H2, and 22H2 for various architectures.
   - Windows 11 versions 21H2, 22H2, and 23H2 for various architectures.
   - Windows Server 2016, 2019, 2022, and their respective editions.

3. Restart your systems after the installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- The updates resolve an elevation of privilege issue that could allow an attacker to gain system privileges if successfully exploited.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a supported version of Windows before applying updates.
- Backup critical data prior to performing the update.
